misc: Known for deliberating his next shot for a long time, leading to somewhat slow play
biography: Panu, a familiar name at the Hector Trophée from Kotojärven Kartanogolf, has a reputation for his thoughtful, if somewhat protracted, approach to the game. Spectators have often noted the meticulous consideration he gives to each shot, a process that, while thorough, does contribute to a measured pace on the course.

Having participated in the Hector Trophée three times, Panu's most notable achievement was securing a victory, a testament to his strategic acumen and skill. While the Victor Trophy has eluded him, his contributions to the team event are well-recognized.

Although Panu is currently considered to be retired from participating in the Hector Trophée, golf enthusiasts should remember that the world of golf is ever dynamic, and there is always a possibility of a comeback.
